title: Ticket #2661: [RFE] enable "condor_status -sort <expression>"
description: Generalize the "-sort" option to condor_status so that it can receive a general expression instead of just an attribute name.
remarks:
2011-Nov-23 15:53:01 by eje:
Also of possible interest: #1770

2011-Dec-02 16:33:04 by eje:
TESTING:

Some examples of new capability to sort on generalized expressions:

On a personal condor with two slots: sorting based on attributes works as before, but now new attributes CondorStatusSortKey<N> and CondorStatusSortKeyExpr<N> are present in sorted output classads 

$ condor_status -l -sort SlotID | grep -e SortKey -e SlotIDSlotID = 1
CondorStatusSortKey0 = 1
CondorStatusSortKeyExpr0 = SlotID
SlotID = 2
CondorStatusSortKey0 = 2
CondorStatusSortKeyExpr0 = SlotID

Now we can use expressions and negate sort key: 

$ condor_status -l -sort -SlotID | grep -e SortKey -e SlotID
SlotID = 2
CondorStatusSortKey0 = -2
CondorStatusSortKeyExpr0 =  -SlotID
SlotID = 1
CondorStatusSortKey0 = -1
CondorStatusSortKeyExpr0 =  -SlotID

An example from scheduler ads, and using two sort keys: 

$ condor_status -schedd -l -sort 'TotalRunningJobs+TotalIdleJobs' -sort Machine | grep -e SortKey -e TotalRunningJobs -e TotalIdleJobs
TotalIdleJobs = 5
TotalRunningJobs = 2
CondorStatusSortKey0 = 7
CondorStatusSortKey1 = rorschach
CondorStatusSortKeyExpr0 = TotalRunningJobs + TotalIdleJobs
CondorStatusSortKeyExpr1 = Machine

As before, classads for which the key is undefined are ignored: 

$ condor_status -l -sort SlotID+Foo | grep -e SortKey -e SlotID
$

Looks fine to me
